Posts.Title: FIRST TIME WITH NED! MCTHO rosie06ct

Posts.Content: juviben wrote: I finished Taxol/Herceptin on November 16th (2011) after doing 4 rounds of AC.  During AC, my eyebrows stayed put but I did lose them during the Taxol round.  I'm still doing Herceptin every three weeks until August.  The eyebrows grew back in January.  Now, it seems like they may be thinning again.  Does this happen?  Can I be losing them, again?  I FINALLY have an inch of hair, eyebrows and eyelashes and will be really sad if they fall out again.  Anyone have this exerience?  If so, do the eyebrows grow back normally again?  I'm a little worried. :-( Dx 4/11/2011, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 3, 0/1 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Eyebrows??? Do they fall out more than once? juviben TSB1

Posts.Content: Apr 8, 2012 06:53PM juviben wrote: The eyelashes seem to be shedding, too.  The nose hair is, too.  WEIRD!!

Posts.Content: juviben wrote: Just had my first dose of weekly Taxol/Herceptin on Wednesday the 31st. Are you supposed to be nauseous with this? I felt none while doing my AC but have with this. I'm having really soft stools, too, a few times a day. Is this common? Also, what about the hair, eyelashes and eyebrows? I lost lots of hair on AC but kept my lashes and brows. What can I expect? My nurses say if I haven't lost them with the AC then I probably won't lose them at all. They also said my hair probably will start growing slowly. Is this true? I really miss my hair. Dx 4/11/2011, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 3, 0/1 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Anyone? Questions about Taxol/Herceptin juviben sheila888

Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2012 11:17PM juviben wrote: I was getting the same comments about keeping it super short and grey.  Problem is, I'm 41 and really don't want a head full of grey hair.  I've colored mine back to it's original color.  I'd just like for it to thicken up on top!!!  It's about 1/2 - 3/4 inch long and tomorrow will be 16 weeks post chemo.  Yikes...  I had nothing on my head at all (except the white fuzz), though, until the first week in January.  I'm SOOO ready for it to start filling in and growing more on top.  I wish I knew how to post a picture...
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 26, 2016 03:58AM juviben wrote: Yep!!! I did. I had great hair before the chemo. Now it's very thin on top and nowhere near what it was before. I had chemo almost 5 years ago and I still can't grow out my hair because of how thin and fine it is on top. Makes me sad.
